title: Emmett Johnson is on pace to be an elite RB
text:
Code
library(tidyverse)


Warning: package 'dplyr' was built under R version 4.4.3


Code
library(gt)
library(ggbeeswarm)
library(ggrepel)




Code
HuskerRBs <- read_csv("Johnson_project.csv")


Rows: 12 Columns: 21
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (6): Name, Season, Team, Conf, Class, Pos
dbl (15): G, Att, RushYds, RushAvg, RushTD, RYPG, Rec, RecYds, RecAvg, RecTD...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.




Code
head(HuskerRBs)


# A tibble: 6 × 21
  Name   Season Team  Conf  Class Pos       G   Att RushYds RushAvg RushTD  RYPG
  <chr>  <chr>  <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>
1 Johns… 2023   Nebr… Big … FR    RB       12    90     411     4.6      2  34.3
2 Johns… 2024   Nebr… Big … SO    RB       13   117     598     5.1      1  46  
3 Johns… BothS… Nebr… Big … Total RB       25   207    1009     4.9      3  34.8
4 Burkh… 2009   Nebr… Big … FR    RB        9    81     346     4.3      3  38.4
5 Burkh… 2010   Nebr… Big … SO    RB       14   172     951     5.5      7  67.9
6 Burkh… BothS… Nebr… Big … Total RB       23   253    1297     5.1     10  56.4
# ℹ 9 more variables: Rec <dbl>, RecYds <dbl>, RecAvg <dbl>, RecTD <dbl>,
#   RecYPG <dbl>, Plays <dbl>, APYds <dbl>, APAvg <dbl>, APTD <dbl>




Code
Rush_Stats <- HuskerRBs |>
  select(Class, Name, Att, RushYds, RushAvg, RushTD)


Emmett Johnson has had an impressive redshirt freshman and sophomore seasons in Nebraska’s backfield. The junior running back is on pace to become an elite tailback.
Here is a comparison to three former Husker running backs for their first two seasons that had success in Lincoln:
Starting with rushing statistics, Johnson is on track to become the elite running back that former Nebraska running backs Ameer Abdullah, Rex Burkhead and Roy Helu were.


Code
Rush_Stats |> 
  gt() |>
  cols_label(
    RushYds = "Yards",
    RushAvg = "Average",
    RushTD = "TDs",
    Name = "Athlete",
    Class = "Year",
    Att = "Attempts"
  ) |>
  tab_header(
    title = "Is Emmett Johnson on pace to be in the same realm of these former Husker RBs with his rushing numbers?",
    subtitle = "Through two seasons, the stats say yes" ) |>
      tab_style(
        style = cell_text(color = "black", weight ="bold", align = "left"),
        locations = cells_title("title") )  |>
          tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "red", align = "left"),
    locations = cells_title("subtitle")) 








Is Emmett Johnson on pace to be in the same realm of these former Husker RBs with his rushing numbers?


Through two seasons, the stats say yes

Code
Rec_Stats <- HuskerRBs |>
  select(Class, Name, Rec, RecYds, RecAvg, RecTD)




Code
head(Rec_Stats)


# A tibble: 6 × 6
  Class Name       Rec RecYds RecAvg RecTD
  <chr> <chr>    <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>
1 FR    Johnson      7     46    6.6     0
2 SO    Johnson     39    286    7.3     2
3 Total Johnson     46    332    7.2     2
4 FR    Burkhead    13     90    6.9     1
5 SO    Burkhead    15    148    9.9     0
6 Total Burkhead    28    238    8.5     1




Code
set.seed(1234)




Code
ggplot() + 
  geom_beeswarm(data=Rec_Stats, aes(x=Rec, y=RecYds), color="red") +
 geom_text_repel(
    data=Rec_Stats, 
    aes(x=Rec, y=RecYds, label=Name))+
theme_minimal() +
labs(
    x = "Receptions", y = "Receiving Yards",
    title = "Johnson's got it won when it comes to catching the ball out of the backfield",
    subtitle = "Imagine the numbers Johnson could put up with a whole year of Holgorsen's savvy scheme",
    caption = "By: Bobby Schneider | Source: sportsreference.com"
  ) 











Code
AP_Stats <- HuskerRBs |>
  select(Class, Name, APYds, APAvg,APTD)




Code
ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=AP_Stats, aes(x= Name, weight=APYds, fill="Type")) + 
  coord_flip() +
  theme_minimal()+
labs(
    x = "Player", y = "All-Purpose Yards",
    title = "Johnson's all-purpose yards compared to these three through two seasons",
    subtitle = "He's a little behind Burkhead and Abdullah, but he's on the right trajectory",
    caption = "By: Bobby Schneider | Source: sportsreference.com"
  )

library(tidyverse)

library(gt)


HuskerRBs <- read_csv("EJ_project.csv")

Rows: 12 Columns: 21
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (6): Name, Season, Team, Conf, Class, Pos
dbl (15): G, Att, RushYds, RushAvg, RushTD, RYPG, Rec, RecYds, RecAvg, RecTD...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

# A tibble: 6 × 21
  Name   Season Team  Conf  Class Pos       G   Att RushYds RushAvg RushTD  RYPG
  <chr>  <chr>  <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>

2 Johns… 2024   Nebr… Big … SO    RB       13   117     598     5.1      1  46

Rush_Stats <- HuskerRBs |>
  select(Class, Name, Att, RushYds, RushAvg, RushTD)


Rush_Stats |> 
  gt() |>
  cols_label(
    RushYds = "Rushing Yards",
    RushAvg = "Average YPC",
    RushTD = "Rushing TDs",
    Name = "Athlete",
    Class = "Year",
    Att = "Rush Attempts"
  ) |>
  tab_header(
    title = "Is Emmett Johnson on pace to be in the same realm of these former Husker RBs?",
    subtitle = "Through two seasons, the stats say yes" ) |>
      tab_style(
        style = cell_text(color = "black", weight ="bold", align = "left"),
        locations = cells_title("title") )  |>
          tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "red", align = "left"),
    locations = cells_title("subtitle")
      )

Schneider’s blog is about sports analysis to decipher what statistics really matter.

title: About
text: Bobby Schneider is a junior at the University of Nebraska-Lincoln, studying sports media and communications. Schneider is a sports journalist who primarily covers Husker football and baseball.
